warmup_exercises.execution_notes: Extend arms to the sides and make small circles, gradually increasing the size. Perform 2 sets of 30 seconds each direction.
Swing arms forward and backward, opening up the chest. Perform 2 sets of 15 swings.

warmup_exercises.setup_notes: Start on all fours with hands under shoulders and knees under hips.
warmup_exercises.execution_notes: Alternate between arching your back (cat) and dropping your belly (cow). Perform 2 sets of 10 reps.
Perform squats, focusing on depth and control. Perform 2 sets of 10 reps.

exercises.setup: Use a preacher bench to angle your upper arm. Adjust the seat so your armpits are snug against the top of the bench.
execution: 1. Sit on the preacher bench with your arms resting on the pad and grab the bar with an underhand grip.
2. Start with your arms fully extended.
3. Curl the bar towards your shoulders, keeping your upper arms stationary.
4. Squeeze your biceps at the top of the movement.
5. Slowly lower the bar back to the starting position, maintaining control.
exercises.weight: Choose a weight that allows you to complete 8-12 reps with good form, typically starting with a light to moderate weight.
exercises.alternative_exercise_setup: Use an incline bench set at a 45-degree angle. Sit back with a dumbbell in each hand, arms hanging straight down.
alternative_exercise_execution: 1. Sit on the incline bench with your back against the pad.
2. Hold the dumbbells with an underhand grip, arms fully extended.
3. Curl the weights up towards your shoulders, keeping your elbows close to your body.
4. Squeeze your biceps at the top.
5. Lower the weights back to the starting position with control.
exercises.alternative_exercise_weight: Select a weight that allows you to perform 8-12 reps with proper form, usually lighter than preacher curls due to the increased range of motion.
exercises.additional_tips: Focus on keeping your elbows locked in place to prevent cheating and maximize biceps engagement.

exercises.setup: Set up the cable at hand height, face away, and take one or two steps forward.
execution: 1. Stand facing away from the cable machine with a handle in each hand.
2. Step forward to create tension in the cables.
3. Curl both handles towards your shoulders simultaneously.
4. Squeeze your biceps at the top of the movement.
5. Slowly lower the handles back to the starting position.
exercises.weight: Use a weight that allows you to maintain form for 8-12 reps, typically starting with a light to moderate weight.
exercises.alternative_exercise_setup: Stand with feet shoulder-width apart, holding a dumbbell in each hand with a neutral grip.
alternative_exercise_execution: 1. Stand with your feet shoulder-width apart, holding dumbbells at your sides.
2. Keep your palms facing each other (neutral grip).
3. Curl the weights up towards your shoulders, keeping your elbows close to your body.
4. Squeeze your biceps at the top.
5. Lower the weights back to the starting position with control.
exercises.alternative_exercise_weight: Choose a weight that allows for 8-12 reps with good form, usually lighter than face away cable curls.
exercises.additional_tips: Keep your elbows stationary and focus on the contraction of the biceps throughout the movement.

exercises.setup: Sit down at a lat pull-down machine and adjust the knee pad to fit snugly against your thighs.
execution: 1. Grip the bar with a wide grip, palms facing forward.
2. Pull the bar down to your upper chest while keeping your back straight.
3. Squeeze your shoulder blades together at the bottom of the movement.
4. Slowly return the bar to the starting position, maintaining control.
exercises.weight: Select a weight that allows you to perform 8-12 reps with proper form, typically starting with a moderate weight.
exercises.alternative_exercise_setup: Sit at the lat pull-down machine with a neutral grip attachment.
alternative_exercise_execution: 1. Sit down and secure your legs under the knee pad.
2. Grip the neutral handle with palms facing each other.
3. Pull the handle down to your upper chest, keeping your back straight.
4. Squeeze your shoulder blades together at the bottom.
5. Slowly return to the starting position.
exercises.alternative_exercise_weight: Choose a weight that allows for 8-12 reps with good form, usually similar to the wide grip lat pull down.
exercises.additional_tips: Focus on pulling with your back muscles rather than your arms to maximize back engagement.

exercises.setup: Use a chest-supported row machine or incline bench.
execution: 1. Lie face down on the bench with your chest supported.
2. Grab the handles or dumbbells with a neutral grip.
3. Pull the weight towards your chest, keeping your elbows close to your body.
4. Squeeze your shoulder blades together at the top.
5. Slowly lower the weight back to the starting position.
exercises.weight: Use a weight that allows you to complete 8-12 reps with good form, typically starting with a moderate weight.
exercises.alternative_exercise_setup: Sit at a cable row machine with feet on the platform and grab the handle with both hands.
alternative_exercise_execution: 1. Sit with your feet on the platform and knees slightly bent.
2. Grab the handle with both hands, arms extended.
3. Pull the handle towards your torso, keeping your back straight.
4. Squeeze your shoulder blades together at the end of the movement.
5. Slowly return to the starting position.
exercises.alternative_exercise_weight: Select a weight that allows for 8-12 reps with proper form, usually similar to the chest supported row.
exercises.additional_tips: Keep your chest pressed against the pad to isolate your back muscles effectively.
